Package au.csiro.pathling.library.query

Class FhirViewQuery

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.library.query.QueryBuilder
au.csiro.pathling.library.query.FhirViewQuery
public class FhirViewQuery extends QueryBuilder
Represents a FHIR view query that can be configured and executed to extract structured data from FHIR resources.

The query can be configured in two ways:

  • Using a JSON string representation of the view via json(String)
  • Using a FhirView object directly via view(FhirView)
Author:
John Grimes

  • Constructor Details

    • FhirViewQuery

      public FhirViewQuery(@Nonnull QueryDispatcher dispatcher, @Nonnull String subjectResource, @Nonnull com.google.gson.Gson gson)
      Creates a new FhirViewQuery instance.
      Parameters:
      dispatcher - the query dispatcher responsible for executing the view query
      subjectResource - the primary FHIR resource type being queried
      gson - the Gson instance used for JSON serialization/deserialization

  • Method Details

    • json

      @Nonnull public FhirViewQuery json(@Nullable String json)
      Configures the query using a JSON string representation of the FHIR view.

      This method deserializes the JSON string into a FhirView object and validates its structure. The JSON should conform to the FhirView schema, defining the resource type, select clauses, where conditions, and other view configuration.

      If the JSON is null, the view configuration remains unchanged.

      Parameters:
      json - the JSON string representation of the FHIR view, or null
      Returns:
      this query instance for method chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the JSON is invalid or the resulting view is not valid

    • view

      @Nonnull public FhirViewQuery view(@Nonnull FhirView fhirView)
      Configures the query using a FhirView object directly.

      This method sets the FHIR view configuration directly using a FhirView object. The view is validated to ensure it has a valid structure and configuration. This is the preferred method when the view is constructed programmatically rather than from JSON.

      Parameters:
      fhirView - the FHIR view configuration to use for this query
      Returns:
      this query instance for method chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the view is not valid

    • execute

      @Nonnull public Dataset<Row> execute()
      Executes the configured FHIR view query and returns the results.

      This method dispatches the configured view to the query dispatcher for execution against the FHIR data source. The result is a Spark Dataset containing rows of extracted data according to the view's select clauses and filtering conditions.

      Specified by:
      execute in class QueryBuilder
      Returns:
      a Spark Dataset containing the query results
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no view has been configured using json(String) or view(FhirView)
